description: The challenge seeks to provide verified digital credentials and digital product passports to achieve full transparency and efficiency in supply chain management.
full_summary:
### Supply Chain Verifiable Digital Credentials

#### Government Tender Announcement

**Reference Number:** cb-8131-96941239
**Solicitation Number:** EN578-20ISC3
**Publication Date:** August 15, 2023
**Tender Closing Date:** September 26, 2023, 14:00:00 (Eastern Daylight Time)
**Expected Contract Start Date:** None
**Expected Contract End Date:** None

**Tender Description:**
The Government of Canada invites eligible businesses to submit proposals for the Supply Chain Verifiable Digital Credentials challenge under the Innovative Solutions Canada (ISC) program.

**Challenge Title:** Supply Chain Verifiable Digital Credentials
**Challenge Sponsor:** Shared Services Canada (SSC) and Treasury Board of Canada Secretariat (TBS)

**Funding Mechanism:** Contract

**Maximum Contract Value:**
Multiple contracts may result from this challenge.

**Phases:**

1. **Phase 1:** Up to six contracts with a maximum funding value of $150,000 CAD, excluding taxes and expenses. Phase 1 contracts will last for up to six months.
2. **Phase 2:** Up to two contracts with a maximum funding value of $1,000,000 CAD, excluding taxes and expenses. Phase 2 contracts will last for up to 18 months.

**Tender Requirements:**

* Propose solutions that digitize supply chain documents with tamper-proof verified credentials.
* Offer identification, authentication, and authorization for supply chain contents.
* Support Universal Bill of Lading (BoL), e-BoL, and other relevant documents.
* Operate across a minimum of two different problem domains.
* Provide end-to-end visibility for authorized parties to track goods from source to destination.
* Address scalability and transaction speed issues.
* Offer alerts and notifications for potential tampering or abuses.

**Challenge Objectives:**

* Enhance supply chain transparency and security.
* Reduce costs and improve efficiency across the supply chain.
* Prevent supply chain fraud and ensure authenticity of goods.

**Evaluation Criteria:**

* Innovation and feasibility of the proposed solution.
* Ability to meet the challenge requirements and objectives.
* Technical and financial viability of the proposed solution.

**Proposal Submission:**
Proposals must be submitted through the ISC website at https://ised-isde.canada.ca/site/innovative-solutions-canada/en/supply-chain-verifiable-digital-credentials.

**Contact Information:**
ISC, SIC
TPSGC.PASIC-APISC.PWGSC
